page.title: 10Landscape
page.content: To the west lies the wide flat floodplain of the{River Lea }(15m OD). The river is contained within the{Lea {Navigation}and the concrete channel of the{Lea Diversion}and flows either side of{King George's Reservoir.}To the east the land rises steadily and increasingly steeply towards the summits of{Barn Hill}80m OD (3897) and {Yardley Hill}67m OD (3895) and { {Gilwell Park, }which mark the break of slope. East of this the landscape is of an undulating nature. A maximum height of 105m is attained north of{ {Day's Farm}(3997). A small stream drains west to the Lea from { {Sewardstonebury}through the steep sided valley between{Yardley Hill}and{ {Hawkwood}(3895).{Cuckoo Brook}rises{ on{Ludgate Plain}and meanders tightly flowing south east through{Bury Wood} (3995) in a broad valley.
